name: John Newman
description:
'''John William Peter Newman''' (born 16 June 1990) is an English singer, songwriter, musician, DJ, composer and record producer. He first gained prominence for  his single "[[Love Me Again (John Newman song)|Love Me Again]]" (2013), which peaked at number one on the [[UK singles chart]], and entered the top ten in over twenty countries. The song also made an appearance in ''[[FIFA 14]].'' His debut album [[Tribute (John Newman album)|''Tribute (2013)'']], reached number one on the [[UK Albums Chart]] and is certified platinum by the [[British Phonographic Industry|BPI]].

Newman's other notable singles include "[[Feel the Love (Rudimental song)|Feel the Love]]" featuring [[Rudimental]] (2012), "[[Cheating (song)|Cheating]]" (2013), "[[Blame (Calvin Harris song)|Blame]]" with [[Calvin Harris]] (2014), "[[Come and Get It (John Newman song)|Come and Get It]]" (2015), and "[[Give Me Your Love (Sigala song)|Give Me Your Love]]" with [[Sigala]] and [[Nile Rodgers]] (2016). As of March 2015, he has achieved four number one UK singles while his second studio album [[Revolve (John Newman album)|''Revolve (2015)'']], reached number three in his home country.

Newman's accolades includes four [[Brit Awards|Brit Awards nominations]], including for British Male Solo Artist in 2014, and an [[Ivor Novello Awards|Ivor Novello Award nomination]]. He is also a recipient of 1 [[Los Premios 40 Principales 2014|Los Premios 40]], 1 [[UK Music Video Awards]], 3 [[BMI Film & TV Awards]], and a [[NME Awards|NME Award]]. As of March 2025 Newman has sold over 6 million records in the UK alone. He is also the younger brother of [[James Newman (singer)|James Newman]].
